title: Create an Experiment Table for a MSA Gage Study
factor1: Name of the Part variable (e.g. Part as default)
factorLevels1: Leave blank to auto-generate values or specify values - example: -1, 1, 'string1', 2, 0
prefixForfactorLevels1: If auto-generate, specify any Prefix. If blank, it will create values as 1,2,3,..
factor2: Name of the Operator variable (e.g. Operator as default)
factorLevels2: Leave blank to auto-generate values or specify values - example: -1, 1, 'string1', 2, 0
prefixForfactorLevels2: If auto-generate, specify any Prefix. If blank, it will create values as 1,2,3,..
replicationVarName: if not left blank, name for replication iteration variable if replication > 1
repeatOnlyChk: Repeat only (instead of true replication - not recommended)
selectRandomSeedRad: Auto generate Random seed (unique every time)
selectFixedRandomSeedRad: Choose as shown or manually change the following Random seed
lbl1: You may not need to change the randomization seed value
sortByOperatorChk: Sort by Operator within each replication

help.title: Auto generate an experiment table for a MSA Gage Study
help.body:
Description
Automatically generates a MSA study table to set up the experiment runs with Part and Operator details based on the parameter specified. If non numeric values are used for Part and Operator, specify within single quote for example 1,-1,'name1',0,'string2'

Once the experment run details are automatically generated, the run table will show up on the data grid UI. The run table can be saved (or 'save as' from the file menu) to create an excel file to use for setting up the experiments
